info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 28 at 10:09PM CDT until July 2 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Black River At Black Rock affecting Independence, Lawrence and Jackson Counties.
For the Black River...including Corning, Pocahontas, Black Rock... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Black River at Black Rock.
* WHEN...From this evening to Wednesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Farm ground along east bank begins to flood. At 17.0 feet, Low lying cultivated land and pastures in Lawrence, Jackson, and Independence counties flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued Sunday evening at 1015 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Independence, AR; Jackson, AR; Lawrence, AR
